item.title: Increase Bandwidth Without Increasing Costs
item.description:
Companies need more bandwidth, especially for their wide area networks (WANs), but it can be very expensive. While high speeds are affordable within a company’s LAN, connecting to the outside world traditionally comes with much higher costs. This is because WAN connections were typically provided by telecom companies using technology initially meant for phone services. item.title: Level 3 Will Light Your Building
item.description:
Ethernet has become the preferred option for WAN (Wide Area Networking), moving beyond its established role in LAN networks. It makes sense to extend your LAN using the same standards both internally and for connecting to remote locations or the internet. A key advantage is cost-effectiveness as bandwidth needs grow.
